file_content.text: Listen up, cutters. We're done kickin' the tar out of these wussy Hutts. Got me a better idea where to grab us some turf.
Load up and grab us some ships. We're rollin' soon as I wrap up some business.
There. Happy, blue-boy?
Let me be crystal clear: if you try anything, the massacre is going to be on your hands.
Dunno, massacre sounds like my kind of party.
We're all getting something out of this arrangement, so keep it civil.
Long as blue-boy don't try crampin' my style, I won't go stickin' 'im. 'Less I get bored.
Sometimes I wonder if diplomacy is really worth the trouble.
Doubt it. The longer you keep yappin' the more I feel like stabbin' somebody.
Save the bloodshed for Zakuul.
Yeah, yeah, they'll get theirs once you tell me where to take my crew.
Now get outta my place. Gotta do some packin'.
We were just leaving.
Nice to meet you too.
Good seeing you too.
Don't make me regret this.
I need to issue my report to command. We should return to headquarters.
Alright, runt. You ain't so bad.
Name's Skadge. Remember it if you're gonna be runnin' with me.
Skadge. I'm <FirstName>.
Didn't ask.
This is the beginning of a beautiful partnership.
It ain't a bad start.
Be sure you remember the favor I just did for you when the time comes.
Don't get pushy.
You always did know how to shake things up. Glad you're still stickin' it to the law.
What can I say? Crime pays.
Ain't that the truth.
A law that forces prisoners to fight wars is a law worth fighting.
Hmph, they're all worth fightin'.
He was an easy guy not to like.
Them righteous types always are.
Listen up, Dead Men. Your slave driver's worm food. You can get lost, or you can join my crew. Just remember: anyone takes a shot at me, they get gutted.
Once I'm done weedin' out the pushovers, Black Sun's gonna roll hard on Zakuul, better believe it.
If you need a hideout, we're based on Odessen.
Might poke around. Gonna need to scope things out before rollin' on those chumps.
Good. I'll be in touch.
Show no mercy.
Never do.
Nobody in this game drops a gift at someone's doorstep outta the kindness of their heart. What're you expectin' for this?
I've got an alliance forming against the Eternal Empire. I want Black Sun's support.
Throw in with your crowd, eh? Long as I'm gettin' my cut of the loot.
A future favor and continual business.
Favor, huh? Yeah, alright.
Just doin' a favor for an old friend.
That right. Goes both ways.
You just seemed more my crowd than the late Fideltin Rusk.
Fideltin? Bwahahaha! Kinda sorry I didn't know that before we offed 'im.
You got something you need from Black Sun, you come to me. 'Specially if it's somethin' bloody.
Think that glow stick hurts? Try crushin' a swoop ganger's neck while his buddies are diggin' in your guts with an oilcan shank.
Stop playin' around with that dinky blaster an' get your hands dirty!
Only need one lung to kill you... just gotta... catch my breath.
This one's not going anywhere. I'm going to give the go-ahead to the clean up teams.
Give it up, Skadge. It's over.
You're beaten, Skadge. Just surrender.
Had to put you in your place, Skadge, but you don't have to go down like this. Work for me, like before, and you walk.
You hear that, Skadge? Last chance to cut a deal before your whole crew has to start taking orders from Rusk here.
That your angle? Work me over 'til you get what you want? I ain't that soft!
I can promise you, the Dead Men won't have trouble mopping up the rest of the scum. There's no need to get him to cooperate.
I prefer to avoid casualties where I can.
Violence should always be the last course of action.
Needless fighting weakens both sides.
I don't think you'll be able to reason with him, but I'll give you a minute.
Any cutters that earned Black Sun colors are goin' down swingin'. Same as me.
We go back. I owe him this much.
He doesn't deserve your sympathy. I'll give you two minutes.
You think just because we got some history I'm gonna let this slide?
No offense, but he's more useful to me with his gang intact.
Think you're takin' us over? Over my dead body.
You don't have to go with him, but you can't stay here. Join my Alliance and you can still be boss of your own kingdom.
You and your crew work for me or you work for him. It's that simple.
You're just making it worse for your people. Tell them to surrender and I promise leniency.
Can't finish what you started? Come 'ere an' I'll show you where to shove your bleedin' heart.
Just sorting the pecking order. How else am I supposed to get a hardcase like you to work for me?
You wanna keep me workin', better make it worth my while, get me?
Listen up, you're working for me now. If you have a problem with that, I'll bury you.
Grr. Fine! Got some guts to strong-arm me. I like what I see, maybe I don't spill'em.
I think you're gonna do what I tell you or I'll be dumping your body at a chop shop.
Grr. Fine! Better be more in this for me than gettin' bossed around, or you're gonna regret it.
I'm not letting him out of here until he gives the order for his goons to pack in.
[Knock Skadge Out] Forget it, it's like talking to a wall.
[Kill Skadge] If you insist.
I just want to see him say he's beaten.
Ha! I ain't beat while I'm still breathin'!
My only concern is what I'm going to do with this particular piece of trash.
Finish cleaning up this trash first.
This business ain't done 'til somebody's bleedin' out in the gutter.
[Knock Skadge Out] Shut up.
Urgh!
[Kill Skadge] I'm dumping you with the rest of the garbage.
Better hope I-- Argh!
Well, what we got here? Ain't them spineless Hutts come knockin', that's for sure.
Hmph, 'sup, runt. Shoulda figured you'd turn up eventually.
Skadge.
Not a bad racket you've got here.
Eh, Coruscant was gettin' dull with all the martial law puttin' a cramp in business.
You don't see me for five years and that's all you've got to say?
You was hopin' I'd get all weepy on account ah you droppin' on my doorstep?
Should've known you'd be behind this mess.
Who else was gonna show these lazy slugs who the real gangsters are?
Don't mind you shootin' up the place. Been gettin' bored anyway. I do mind you draggin' in garbage off the street.
You know this scum?
We did some work together in the past.
Best muscle a contract killer could hope for.
Got to kill all sorts of interestin' people with you around.
Don't tell me you got nabbed an' collared by these losers.
Unfortunately.
Yeah, you wasn't my favorite neither.
Just a loose end I never got around to tying up.
Yeah, I'd have liked to seen that. Thought I'd missed my shot at takin' a shot at you.
This the wimpy crowd you're running with now? Didn't think you could do worse than that last crew.
How'd you get tied up with a buncha second-rate hoods playin' toy soldier?
Got a turf war of my own. Looking to recruit for a showdown with the Eternal Empire.
Pssh, so you throw in with these chumps? Ain't good for nothing but bleedin' on the ground.
Contact sent me their way. Worked out a deal. This complicates things.
Killin' ain't complicated.
Doesn't matter. We're here to bust up your operation.
Stinkin' bounty hunters. Can't figure which side of the law to stand on.
Alright scum, I'm giving you one--and only one--opportunity to surrender peacefully.
Just 'cause you collared some small-timers back on Coruscant don't mean you're ready to tangle with the big dogs.
Some runty Jedi an' a bunch of cannon fodder.
Couple army chumps and their cannon fodder.
Smirkin' moron with a crew to match.
That's Commander Moron to you, ugly.
Gonna be real easy to grin when I pull your lips off.
Get a load of the Sith rollin' with a buncha Republic flunkies.
Bow down and I may spare your wretched lives.
Hmph. Save it for your regular bootlicks. Black Sun don't beg.
Your own taste in company leaves something to be desired.
Hmph. Anybody you managed to bump off, I don't need anyway.
Some shifty lookin' twerp an' the wimpiest posse I ever seen.
You should surrender while you have the chance.
Safe to say this is the ringleader?
Matches the description. The file says this one escaped from Belsavis, so whatever he did to get in there is probably as sick as what he did to get out.
Heh, the best bits ain't written in anythin' but blood.
Big mouth for someone whose gang has barely put up a fight.
Get the drop on some of my boys an' expect me to scram. You're messin' with the wrong crowd, wimp.
Awfully brave to be hurling insults in your position.
You ain't nothin' I ain't seen before.
Jedi, always thinkin' you're gonna wave your hands and wipe the scum away. 'Til you meet a real cutter that don't scurry when you flick that light on.
Just cause you was able to put some of those chumps on a leash don't mean we're gonna roll over for you.
All you Sith think you're tough, 'til you got a knife in your gut. Then you're all surprised an' belly-achin' 'bout how you was meant for some bigger nonsense.
When I go, you won't see me blubberin'.
You army types think a couple push-ups and a gun's gonna make you hard. Ain't seen real brass 'til you've strangled a pack of search hounds bare-handed.
Those lap dogs you got look plenty tamed. Dead Men's right.
'Nother stupid tourist lookin' to slum it an' run back to your fancy-pants digs before the stink sets in.
How 'bout we give you some scars for souvenirs? Send a message to the law that sent you.
Imps think all that bow and scrape for the Sith means you ain't gotta be scared of us street types.
You wanna bend your knees so bad, may as well break 'em. That ain't how we roll.
Black Sun ain't gonna be hitched to your little chain gang.
The job says otherwise.
Yeah, yeah. Don't go cryin' "it weren't personal" when I'm steppin' on your spine.
That's not for you to decide.
Don't think I ain't gettin' my say in.
You're saying this outfit is forcing gangers to fight?
Whatya think they been doin', holdin' tryouts? Been seein' Dead Men all over Coruscant bustin' up gangs and pressin' 'em into service.
What do you mean by that?
Don't act dumb. We seen you Dead Men collaring gangsters all 'round Coruscant. Pressin' 'em into service.
Never been one for slavin', but you dregs got a nice racket goin'.
Stow that nonsense. Making you pay back your debt to society is nothing like selling innocent people as property!
So he's telling the truth. You'll force them to fight?
They'll be charged, tried, and sentenced. Most will fit the service requirements for the legion.
Better than he deserves.
Bad move, runt. Ain't gonna get no mercy from me.
I'm okay with that.
I helped you to end the gang war, not flip gangsters into cannon fodder. I can give Black Sun a reason to back off. You willing to deal?
I'll help you stop the gang war, I won't help you draft unwilling soldiers. You willing to make a deal?
[Betray Rusk] You're as bad as they are. Maybe worse. The legion's done taking your orders.
It's closer than I'm comfortable with.
It's not up to you. The Republic's policy is clear, as are my orders.
You're right, this isn't the time or place. We apprehend the gang first.
[Betray Rusk] And just how do your troops feel about it? Why don't we ask?
That might work for some, but you won't be able to reform Skadge. He's got to be put down.
That's a mercy they don't deserve.
Like your payback pure, same as me. Come on, runt, get yours!
[Betray Rusk] Think I side with Skadge on this one. You're the only true Dead Man here.
Hold up, Rusk. I can work this out.
How about we make a deal?
You bust in on my turf, put some of my boys in the dirt and say you want to deal? One way to get my attention.
What are you doing? We have the target surrounded and my troops are waiting for the all-clear to take his operation apart.
Rusk, your mission is to stop the gang war on Nar Shaddaa. Nobody said it had to be through force.
You should have brought this up before the operation was underway.
I'm exploring my options.
If I don't like what I hear, the conversation's over.
I ain't interested in your ball-an'-chain act. Got somethin' worth sayin', spit it out.
Join my Alliance. You and your gang could probably cause some real damage.
Causin' plenty of damage here an' I ain't gotta listen to nobody tryin' to give me orders.
[Betray Rusk] Who said you have to stop giving the orders? There's a whole army here.
If you want to get the Hutts and Republic off your back, I know a way.
Maybe I like things the way they is. Tanglin' with these losers just keeps me from gettin' bored.
It's my deal, or the Dead Man's Legion takes you down.
[Betray Rusk] You want to stave off boredom, or you want to run this town? I just brought you an army.
What're you wastin' our time for? Plug this twerp and I'll show you what bein' boss of Nar Shaddaa's really like.
I've got some serious payback I owe the Eternal Empire. I'm pulling in a favor.
When we tracked down Zale Barrows on Belsavis all them years back, I didn't get the revenge I was promised. What kind of favor I owe a double-dealer?
I got you off Belsavis, for one.
An' I killed who you needed killin'. Seems we're square.
Okay, Rusk, I tried. We do it your way.
Gimme your best shot!
[Betray Rusk] How about I give you the Dead Men?
We're tight. What makes you think we're "pack up an' ditch my turf" tight?
Back on Belsavis, you got your revenge on Zale Barrows because of me. Not to mention I got you off that rock.
Suppose I did get to bleed a couple punks who crossed me on account of you... I'm listenin'.
You gave your word that Black Sun would have my back.
Yeah, I ain't forgotten. Whatcha need?
I want Black Sun to throw in with my alliance. Once the Eternal Empire is dealt with, you can do as you like.
Only 'cause it's you askin'.
Just lay off the Hutts and Republic. There's plenty of territory up for grabs on Zakuul.
[Betray Rusk] The army of ex-cons I've got for you.
Hehe, that's more like it!
Come on, Skadge. You really want to play around in the minor leagues when there's way bigger scores out there?
Hmph, the Hutts may be pushovers, but they ain't small time. What're you drivin' at?
There's a whole criminal underworld ripe for the picking on Zakuul. You could be the first syndicate to stake a claim there.
Hmm. Bet those Zakuulans put up a better fight than the slugs or these wimps.
Okay, killer, you got a deal.
Alright, runt. You give me somethin' to keep me busy, I don't put much thought into killin' you.
This is a bad call. They can back out of the turf war here, but the Republic isn't going to deal with an organization that supports Black Sun.
Trust me, I know how to handle the Houk.
You still haven't assured me that I can count on your army for support. This one can promise me that much, at least.
You're asking for a knife in the back, but fine.
No, trying to reform Skadge is the bad idea. He's just a natural disaster you have to steer someplace else.
My superiors may be satisfied with turning the problem toward our mutual enemy.
If we all want to tear each other apart, there will be time for that. For now, I think a truce is best for everyone.
Victory at any cost. If you think this is necessary, then fine.
He has to give the order to withdraw and my forces make sure they follow through.
[Betray Rusk] I may not have your support, but I think I have the Dead Men's.
[Betray Rusk] You're staring at an army of ex-cons waiting for a real kingpin.
That's enough! Dead Men, take the objective!
I've been wanting to beat you down for way too long, Skadge.
Oh yeah, this is gonna be good.
Then you can die, Skadge.
Heh, I like you. Gonna enjoy makin' you bleed.
[Betray Rusk] The campaign ends here, Rusk.
Haha, wasn't expectin' that was yah, twerp?
Any of you worthless gutter punks wanna show me you ain't gone soft? Show blue-boy how we handle the law here an' I might keep you around.
Have you lost your mind?
Thanks for backing my decision, Rusk.
You've earned that much, at least.
[Betray Rusk] I've never liked how you operate, Rusk. It's time to put an end to it.
Master Jedi? No!
[Betray Rusk] I know how you do things all too well, Rusk. I'll take them over you.
